item.title: 亿万富翁气候活动家谈私人飞机引发的冲突
item.description: 迈克-坎农-布鲁克斯（Mike Cannon-Brookes）是澳大利亚的一位亿万富翁，因其在气候变化问题上的立场而闻名。【原文：Mike Cannon-Brookes, an Australian billionaire known for his stance on climate change, said he has a deep internal conflict over the use of his private jet for travel.】

item.title: 中国新碳排放权交易引发价格剧烈波动
item.description: 2017 年以来，中国发放的首批自愿碳信用额的交易价格波动剧烈。【原文：Trading of the first voluntary carbon credits issued in China since 2017 has delivered wild price swings.】

item.title: 能源巨头甩开 DeepSeek，专注于为人工智能繁荣提供动力
item.description: 本周，在休斯敦举行的一次重要能源会议上，关税和宏观经济担忧对石油前景造成了影响，而围绕人工智能及其高昂的电力需求所产生的情绪却截然不同。【原文：While tariffs and macroeconomic concerns weighed on the outlook for oil at a major energy conference in Houston this week, the mood around artificial intelligence and its sky-high power needs could scarcely be different.】

item.title: 特朗普将在白宫宴请纽约州议员霍楚尔讨论输油管道问题
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，他将于周五与纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）会面，讨论能源管道计划等议题。【原文：President Donald Trump said he would meet with New York Governor Kathy Hochul on Friday to discuss plans for an energy pipeline, among other topics.】

item.title: 力拓支持美国废料回收项目，关税影响废料流通
item.description: 就在特朗普政府的贸易政策扰乱全球废料流动之际，力拓集团正在投资 Exurban 公司，该公司计划在印第安纳州建厂，从手机、电脑和其他电子废料中回收金属。【原文：Rio Tinto Group is investing in Exurban, a company planning to build an Indiana plant to recover metals from mobile phones, computers and other electronic waste, just as the Trump administration’s trade policies upend global scrap flows.】

item.title: 英国支持的 FSD 将为非洲气候项目筹资 3 亿美元
item.description: 由英国政府支持的非洲可持续发展基金会（FSD Africa）表示，它计划今年从投资者那里筹集 3 亿美元，用于该地区的气候项目。【原文：FSD Africa, an organization backed by the UK government, says it plans to raise $300 million from investors this year for climate projects in the region.】

item.title: 北极风暴将对欧洲能源系统造成压力
item.description: 未来一周，一股北极气流将给欧洲带来冰冷的气温和低风速，给本已因天然气库存枯竭而举步维艰的能源系统带来压力。【原文：A blast of Arctic air will bring icy temperatures and low wind speeds to Europe over the next week, putting pressure on energy systems already struggling with depleted natural gas inventories.】

item.title: 爱沙尼亚与其他国家一道呼吁欧盟推迟新燃料碳市场的建立
item.description: 爱沙尼亚与欧盟其他国家一道，敦促欧盟推迟甚至取消针对运输和取暖燃料的新碳市场，因为人们担心这会提高能源成本。【原文：Estonia joined other European Union nations in urging the bloc to delay or even scrap a new carbon market for transportation and heating fuels, on concerns it could boost energy costs.】

item.title: 壳牌 2024 年向船舶交付创纪录数量的船用液化天然气
item.description: 壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）表示，该公司将在 2024 年交付创纪录的 110 万吨船用液化天然气，为船舶提供动力。【原文：Shell Plc said it delivered a record 1.1 million tons of marine liquefied natural gas to power vessels in 2024, as the world’s largest LNG player sees expanding use of the fuel that has become crucial to the energy transition.】

item.title: 芯片竞赛喷射 "永恒的化学物质"，初创企业崛起摧毁它们
item.description:
从半导体到雨衣，PFAS 无处不在。随着对这些物质的监管力度加大，清洁这些物质的新方法也在不断涌现。【原文：

PFAS are in everything from semiconductors to raincoats. As regulations on the substances increase, new ways of cleaning them up are on the rise.

】

item.title: 2025 年非洲太阳能发电装机将大幅增长
item.description: 据一份新的行业报告称，去年非洲国家的太阳能发电装机量保持快速增长，2025 年该行业有望继续增长。【原文：African countries maintained a brisk pace of solar power installation last year and the sector looks set to keep growing in 2025, according to a new industry report.】

item.title: 北欧联合银行购买碳减排信用额度以扩大市场规模
item.description: 北欧联合银行（Nordea Bank Abp）已同意从一个捕集二氧化碳并将其埋入北海海底的项目中购买至少 68,000 个信用额度。【原文：Nordea Bank Abp has agreed to buy at least 68,000 credits from a project that will capture carbon dioxide and bury it under the North Sea.】

item.title: 巴巴多斯领导人从沉没之岛提出气候务实主义
item.description:
"希望是我们选择的一种状态，无论我们遇到的困难是大是小，我们都会选择它，"巴巴多斯总理米娅-莫特利在本周的零点节目中说道。【原文：

“Hope is a condition that we choose, and we choose it irrespective of whether our difficulties are great or small,” Mia Mottley, prime minister of Barbados, says on this week’s episode of Zero. 

】

item.title: 中国扩大非常规天然气钻探补贴范围
item.description: 中国正在延长一项支持非常规天然气钻探的补贴计划，以继续推动新的国内供应，确保能源安全。【原文：China is extending a subsidy program to support unconventional natural gas drilling as it continues to push for new domestic supplies to ensure energy security.】

item.title: 基础设施基金斥资 3 亿美元瞄准被忽视的亚洲市场
item.description: 一个由欧洲各国政府支持的基础设施基金旨在向亚洲发展中国家的气候项目投资至少 3 亿美元，这些国家通常很难获得资金。【原文：An infrastructure fund backed by European governments aims to invest at least $300 million in climate-focused projects in developing nations in Asia that typically struggle to access funding.】

item.title: 新西兰海底采矿给海上风电带来前所未有的挑战
item.description: 据一家国际风力发电场开发商称，新西兰鼓励在可以建设海上风力发电的同一海域进行海底采矿的意愿是史无前例的。【原文：New Zealand’s willingness to encourage seabed mining in the same piece of ocean where offshore wind generation could be built is unprecedented, according to an international wind farm developer.】

item.title: 比尔-盖茨的气候组织裁撤美国和欧洲政策团队
item.description: 由微软公司联合创始人比尔-盖茨（Bill Gates）资助的气候组织 "突破能源"（Breakthrough Energy）已在美国和欧洲裁员数十人，退出了作为其使命基石的公共政策倡导工作。【原文：Breakthrough Energy, the climate group funded by Microsoft Corp. co-founder Bill Gates, has laid off dozens of employees in the US and Europe as it pulls back from public policy advocacy work that was a cornerstone of its mission.】

item.title: 富国陷入混乱，巴巴多斯呼吁全球南方国家采取气候行动
item.description: 巴巴多斯总理米娅-莫特利（Mia Mottley）呼吁发展中国家在气候问题上共同努力，以此抵御富国领导力缺失和资金削减。【原文：Barbados Prime Minister Mia Mottley called on developing countries to work together on climate as a way to counteract absent leadership and cuts in funding from rich countries.】

item.title: 美国环保局将重新审议美国气候变化规则的法律依据
item.description: 美国环境保护局周三表示，将重新考虑奥巴马政府所谓的 "濒危结论"，此举可能会破坏全面气候变化规则的法律基础。【原文：The Environmental Protection Agency said Wednesday it will reconsider the Obama administration’s so-called endangerment finding, a move that could dismantle the legal foundation for sweeping climate change rules.】

item.title: 英国部长谈及欧盟市场联系时，英国碳价飙升
item.description: 一位财政部长表示，政府将考虑把英国的排放市场与欧盟的体系联系起来，此后英国碳期货周三跳涨。【原文：UK carbon futures jumped on Wednesday after a Treasury minister said the government would consider linking the country’s emissions market to the European Union’s system.】

item.title: 特朗普的环保局瞄准拜登遏制电厂污染的政策
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的环保负责人提出修改拜登时代的气候指令，以遏制美国发电厂的温室气体污染。【原文：President Donald Trump’s environmental chief moved to revise Biden-era climate mandates curbing greenhouse gas pollution from the nation’s power plants.】

item.title: 洛杉矶面临新风暴带来的暴雨和泥石流威胁
item.description: 周三晚些时候，暴雨和大雪将席卷南加州，增加了整个地区发生泥石流和洪水的风险，包括一月份毁灭性大火的发生地。【原文：Heavy rain and snow will sweep across Southern California late Wednesday, raising the risk of mudslides and flooding across the region, including the sites of January’s devastating fires.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车电池先驱 Northvolt 是如何陷入困境的？
item.description: 鉴于中国在许多低碳技术领域的领先地位，欧洲要在绿色工业领域引领世界的雄心壮志始终会是一种奢望。就电动汽车电池而言，前景尤其暗淡。【原文：Europe’s ambition to lead the world in green industries was always going to be a stretch given China’s head-start in many low-carbon technologies. When it comes to electric vehicle batteries, the outlook is especially bleak.】

item.title: 美国内政部长称联邦土地上的资源是价值数万亿美元的资产
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的内政部长提出，他负责监管的广袤联邦土地和水域中的石油、天然气和矿产应被视为价值数万亿美元的 "美国资产负债表 "的一部分。【原文：Donald Trump’s Interior Secretary is making the case that the oil, gas and minerals in the vast federal lands and waters he is charged with overseeing should be viewed as part of “America’s balance sheet” worth trillions of dollars.】

item.title: 德国绿党在历史性协议中成为罕见的权力掮客
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注德国绿党的一个危险筹码，因为德国下任总理需要绿党就新的国防开支计划达成一致。如需不受限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at a risky bargaining chip for Germany’s Green party as the country’s next chancellor needs them to agree on a plan for new defense spending. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 野村退出气候银行集团，加入华尔街主导的出走潮
item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. is leaving the banking industry’s largest climate alliance, joining Japanese peer Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc. as an exodus started by Wall Street heavyweights goes global.】

item.title: 寻求 450 亿美元气候基金的交易有望在美国退出
item.description: 分析人士认为，为新兴经济体提供约 450 亿美元资金的气候计划不会因美国决定退出而受到影响。【原文：Climate programs targeting about $45 billion in funding for emerging economies won’t be derailed by America’s decision to withdraw, according to analysts.】

item.title: 澳大利亚气候金融家敦促选民支持独立人士
item.description: 澳大利亚气候活动家和金融家西蒙-霍姆斯-考特（Simon Holmes a Court）呼吁对主要政党感到失望的选民在即将举行的选举中支持独立立法者，让他们在可能出现悬峙的议会中发挥更大的影响力。【原文：Australian climate activist and financier Simon Holmes a Court has called on voters frustrated by major parties to support independent lawmakers at the forthcoming election, giving them more influence in a potential hung parliament.】

item.title: 环保局终止 200 亿美元气候项目拨款
item.description: 环境保护局表示，它将终止根据前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）签署的气候法设立的绿色银行计划所发放的 200 亿美元赠款。【原文：The Environmental Protection Agency said it’s terminating $20 billion in grants awarded through a green bank program established under former President Joe Biden’s signature climate law.】

item.title: 中国太阳能行业领导者对行业痛点只提出了缓慢的补救措施
item.description: 中国太阳能行业的知名人士在中国年度议会上提出了一些解决方案，这些方案可以从长远角度帮助他们陷入困境的行业，但对止住当前的失血并无多大帮助。【原文：Chinese solar sector luminaries offered solutions at China’s annual parliament that could help their beleaguered industry in the long-term — but not much to staunch the current bleeding.】
